definition: lit. so numerous that one could just bend down and pick them up (idiom)/fig. extremely common/easily available
to pick up/to collate or arrange/ten (banker's anti-fraud numeral)

sentences.english: Everyday life is full of opportunities to establish loving connections with our kids.
sentences.chinese: 日常生活中和孩子們建立愛的聯繫的機會俯拾皆是。

sentences.english: Hebei is also one of the provinces of many cultural relics.
sentences.chinese: 河北的文物古蹟更是俯拾皆是。

sentences.english: This kind of romanticism is everywhere in Buchan's books.
sentences.chinese: 這種浪漫思想在巴肯的書中俯拾皆是。

sentences.english: Instances such as these are extremely common.
sentences.chinese: 諸如此類的事例俯拾皆是。

sentences.english: In foreign language learning, numerous learner variables are generally said to influence the success or failure of language learning.
sentences.chinese: 外語學習中，影響成敗的學習者變量俯拾皆是。

sentences.english: This is common in our life.
Herbs for the prevention of encephalitis can be found everywhere in this area.
sentences.chinese: 預防腦炎的草藥在這一地區俯拾皆是。

sentences.english: This feels just like being at the bottom of the ocean and seeing all of the amazing creatures1 everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 這感覺就像是在海底觀賞俯拾皆是的奇異生物。

definition: see 俯拾皆是[fu3 shi2 jie1 shi4]
too numerous to mention individually or one by one
lit. enough books to make a pack-ox sweat or to fill a house to the rafters (idiom); fig. many books
rare as morning stars (idiom)/few and far between/sparse
lit. measured in cartloads and gallons/fig. by the barrowload (i.e. lots and lots)/innumerable
at all times and in all places (idiom)
by no means an isolated case/numerous
vast as the open sea (idiom); fig. extensive (library)
